newsitem.title: ISRAEL: PLO policeman gets 15-year term for killing Arab.
newsitem.headline: PLO policeman gets 15-year term for killing Arab.

text.p: A Palestinian military court sentenced a PLO policeman on Tuesday to 15 years in jail for killing a man who ignored orders to stop at a checkpoint in the West Bank town of Hebron, a security official said.

"He was arrested and tried by a military court. He was sentenced to 15 years in jail for killing a Palestinian who refused to stop at a checkpoint in a dangerous place in Hebron," said a senior PLO security official, adding that the incident occurred on Monday.
The official said PLO police ordered the victim, 29-year-old Issam Mohammad Gheith, to stop at a Palestinian checkpoint near an area in Hebron still under Israeli security control.
"But he would not stop and drove around the policemen on the pavement, so one policeman shot one bullet from his pistol and this bullet killed Gheith," said the official, who refused to be named.

Palestinian forces patrol most of Hebron -- home to more than 100,000 Palestinians -- since Israel handed it over to the PLO under a peace deal in January. Israeli troops guard an enclave inside the city where 400 Jews have settled.
